intro: Enterospermum madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces yellow or orange fruits with a rough, warty surface, which contain multiple seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a hairy texture. Enterospermum madagascariense is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and plays a role in local ecosystems.
